title: compiler panicked on Linux (WSL) aarch64
body:
I was trying to install [Zola](https://github.com/getzola/zola) on a Surface Pro X running WSL (Ubuntu). Rust is running inside WSL with the following version `rustc 1.41.0 (5e1a79984 2020-01-27) running on aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu`. It panicked and told me to come here fill an issue:

This is the output:

~~~~
   Compiling parse-zoneinfo v0.2.1
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_typeck/check/mod.rs:2795: no type for local variable local end (hir_id=HirId { owner: DefIndex(825), local_id: 458 })
   --> /home/soapdog/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/syn-0.15.44/src/lit.rs:803:20
    |
803 |         for end in s[s.len() - pounds..].bytes() {
    |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:864:9
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.41.0 (5e1a79984 2020-01-27) running on aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C codegen-units=1 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: aborting due to previous error

error: could not compile `syn`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
soapdog@Cleo:/mnt/c/Users/andre/prog/rust/zola$
~~~~
